basics.name: John Wu
basics.label: Computer Science and Engineering Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: Computer Science and Engineering Ph.D. student at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign with a strong background in research, teaching, and industry experience.

work.company: Sun Lab, Department of Computer Science, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
work.summary: Improved automated interpretability methods for clinical text classification using large language models. Cleaned and processed clinical text data with NLP toolkits. Scaled model training on massive clinical text corpus through distributed computing with Dask.

work.company: Das Lab, Steve and Cindy Rasmussen Institute for Genomic Medicine
work.summary: Developed parameter estimation software BioNetGMMFit in C/C++ for rule-based and mechanistic modeling. Utilized parallel programming to improve particle swarm optimization performance up to a factor of 10x. Analyzed mass cytometry datasets, generating parameter estimates through generalized method of moments. Trained a convolutional neural network to analyze an image mass cytometry dataset of breast cancer. Used deep learning library, deepXDE, for parameter estimation of PDE models.

work.company: Rerout Lab, Department of Computer Science, The Ohio State University
work.summary: Built prototype docker containerization infrastructure for model commons project, allowing for ease of Python code shareability. Benchmarked different particle swarm optimization configurations, contributing to a model benchmarking paper for model commons. Collaborated and communicated plans and necessary data to write benchmarking paper.

Developed Selective Harmonic Elimination Pulse Width Modulation firmware for lab-grade industrial coolers, improving power efficiency. Programmed microcontrollers' interrupt vectors to set up failsafes in case of power failures. Assisted in pre-prototyping research, devising early plans for prototype design and bills of materials. Tested analog-digital camera sensors, ensuring functionality and quality standards.

volunteer.organization: Hometown Ambassadors, The Ohio State University
volunteer.summary: Presented OSU's engineering program during STEM Outreach activities for high school students. Shared personal experiences in engineering with students and answered specific questions about the program.

awards.title: Abstract of Distinction, Abigail Wexner Research Institute Research Retreat
Best of Student Startups Finalist, Keenan Center for Entrepreneurship

publications.name: Generalized Method of Moments Improves Parameter Estimation in Biochemical Signaling Models of Time-Stamped Single-Cell Snapshot Data
publications.summary: Under review in PLOS Computational Biology

publications.name: BioNetGMMFit: A Parameter Estimation Tool for BioNetGen Using Single-Cell Snapshot Data from Cell Populations Evolving over Time
A Reflection on AI Model Selection for Digital Agriculture Image Datasets
publications.publisher: 37th Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence Conference (AAAI-23)

publications.name: A Case for Dataset Specific Profiling
If LLM Is the Wizard, Then Code Is the Wand: A Survey on How Code Empowers Large Language Models to Serve as Intelligent Agents
